stem: A client with Syndrome of Inappropriate Antidiuretic Hormone (SIADH) is being treated with fluid restriction. Based on the documentation in the Serial Hyponatremia & Neuro-Metabolic Log, which action is the highest priority?

tabs.title: Serum & Urine Trends
tabs.content:
TestResultStatus
Serum Sodium (Na+)118 mEq/LCritically Low
Serum Osmolality242 mOsm/kgLow
Urine Specific Gravity1.034Highly Concentrated
Urine Osmolality850 mOsm/kgHigh

tabs.title: Neurological Status
tabs.content: Current: Client is increasingly confused and 'sleepy.' Reports a severe, pounding headache. Deep tendon reflexes (DTRs) are 1+ (Hyporeflexive). New onset of muscle twitching in the left arm noted.

tabs.title: Selected Orders
tabs.content:
1. Fluid restriction: 500 mL/day.
2. Seizure precautions.
3. Administer 3% Hypertonic Saline at 30 mL/hr if Na+ < 120.

options.text: Initiate 3% Hypertonic Saline through a central venous catheter
Enforce strict bed rest with all four side rails up
Offer the client sugar-free hard candy to relieve extreme thirst
Educate the client on the importance of limiting water intake

rationale.correct: The client has severe, symptomatic hyponatremia (Na+ 118) and is showing signs of cerebral edema (headache, twitching, confusion). The **highest priority is 3% Hypertonic Saline (a1)**. This 'super-salty' IV fluid works by shifting water OUT of the brain cells and back into the vascular space, thereby reducing intracranial pressure and preventing fatal seizures. It must be infused slowly and ideally via a central line due to its high osmolarity.
clinicalPearls: In SIADH, the sodium is low because the water is high (dilutional hyponatremia).
Correction of Na+ must be slow; if you fix it too fast, you can cause 'Central Pontine Myelinolysis' (permanent brain stem damage).

questionTrap.howToOvercome: While seizure precautions are necessary, they don't fix the *underlying cause* of the brain swelling. Education is never the priority during a critical neurological decline.

mnemonic.title: S-I-A-D-H
mnemonic.expansion: S-Sodium is low. I-Intracranial pressure. A-Always watch the brain. D-Danger level < 120. H-Hypertonic Saline (3%).
